alert.note: Alert for Clark; Jackson; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 20 at 10:51PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Clark, Jackson and northeastern Trempealeau Counties through 1145 PM CDT... At 1049 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles east of Owen to near Whitehall. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Colby around 1100 PM CDT. Black River Falls around 1120 PM CDT. Millston around 1135 PM CDT. This includes Interstate 94 between mile markers 88 and 132. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for central and west central Wisconsin.
